alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 18 at 9:01PM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River Near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr, with this Watch valid for the stretch of the river from the Dawson-Lincoln County line downstream to near Lexington. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet, and was very slowly rising. - Forecast...Due to significant recent precipitation upstream along the South Platte River, particularly in Colorado, elevated water levels are gradually working eastward along the Platte River in Nebraska. If current forecasts remain on track, the gauge near Darr could reach minor flood stage of 10.0 feet on Tuesday afternoon, and then perhaps continue rising to a crest around 10.7 feet on Thursday before slowly falling. Please note that there is still some uncertainty with this river forecast, but if later forecasts continue to support a likelihood of minor flooding, then this Watch will likely be upgraded to a Warning at some point during the next 24 to 36 hours. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
